sn38.1:1.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.
sn38.1:1.2: Then the wanderer Jambukhādaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.
sn38.1:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Sāriputta:
sn38.1:2.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
sn38.1:2.3: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
sn38.1:2.5: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
sn38.1:2.8: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn38.1:2.9: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn38.1:2.10: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
sn38.1:2.11: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
sn38.1:2.12: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”
